answers.answer: Hello,There are a few causes of sugar in urine chief ones being diabetes, Cushing’s syndrome and kidney disease causing chronic renal disease. I suggest you to get your blood sugar levels done and if possible get your HBA1C levels done which gives more consistent results than blood sugar levels. Also get a urine culture done after leaving antibiotics so that the exact antibiotic can be started.Hope it helps. Take care and please do keep me posted if you have any additional queries. Kind regards.

question: Hi - went to doctor, thought I had a bladder infection. He took urine sample and said bacteria was low, but noted sugar in urine.  Gave me cipro in case it was a uti.  I feel that the cipro kept the itching under control for a few days. but now that I am done with it, the itching is coming back.  Any ideas?
title: Itching but not a UTI?  What next?
